Remember when Pantheon got his legendary skin, and also got huge nerfs in the same patch?
They said that working on new skins makes them notice the champ more, and end up seeing bugs, or the fact that they might need tuning (nerfs or buffs).

It makes sense as everyone on the team is talking about the champ, playing them to test out the skin, and they'll start to notice more things or get gameplay/balance ideas.

That definitely makes sense and noone is doubting that.

But when those "gameplay/balance ideas" boil down to:

- buff health per level
- buff armor per level
- buff base mr
- buff mr per level
- buff passive duration
- buff Q damage at later ranks
- buff W damage at all ranks

All with absolutely no real gameplay changes then we get a little skeptical.

Support wise I'd say give the Ultimate skin to a tank support, as even though we recently got the Leona legendary skin (and its chroma that should've been a Diana skin lmao) tank supports for the most part aren't exactly well looked after in the skins department apart from Thresh (yes, I count him as a tank support).

Okay, but what supports are popular enough to warrant a skin when the role itself is so massively unpopular? Enchanters are universally despised as boring, and mage supports as horribly unfun, leaving (Traditional) support tanks, which rarely see any play outside of pros, and playmaking combo champs like {{champion:432}} {{champion:53}} {{champion:555}} {{champion:412}} {{champion:497}} {{champion:12}} {{champion:89}}

Janna and Thresh have been the most popular supps for years, Janna only fell down this season in popularity.

It's not hard to understand why they got their legendary skins years ago.
